2. Is she
 in labour?
The clinician must make the diagnosis of labour and not only rely on the woman’s history. The differential
diagnosis includes but is not limited to labour, urinary tract infection, amniotic fluid infection, (early) abruptio
placentae, false labour or gastro-enteritis.
History taking and review of the antenatal record 
• Carefully review the antenatal record, especially the gestational age, blood results and HIV status. Clearly
note all the r
